card.text: Belonged to Judge Laban Wheaton, the founder of Wheaton Female Seminary.
The building was used for the housing of male students that were attending Wheaton College via exchange programs.
The building became know as the Multicultural Center in 1986.
Due to her commitment to diversity here at Wheaton College, the Building was dedicated to the former president of Wheaton College, Dale Rogers Marshall.

Now, the Marshall Center exists to affirm the unique identities on campus, to build a community that draws from them and to cultivate leaders who will introduce to the world the value of human diversity.
